Science.text: Quiet people have the loudest minds
Science.author: Stephen Hwaking

Science.text: One never notices what has been done; one can only see what remains to be done.
Science.author: Marie Curie

Science.text: The science of today is the technology of tomorrow.
Science.author: Edward Teller

Science.text: Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition.
Science.author: Adam Smith

Science.text: No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess.
Science.author: Issac Newton

Science.text: A discovery is said to be an accident meeting a prepared mind.
Science.author: Louis Pasteur

Science.text: Science does not know its debt to imagination.
Science.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Funny.text: The elevator to success is out of order. You’ll have to use the stairs, one step at a time.
Funny.author: Joe Girard

Funny.text: Be a positive energy trampoline—absorb what you need and rebound more back.
Funny.author: Dave Carolan

Funny.text: People often say that motivation doesn’t last. Well, neither does bathing—that’s why we recommend it daily.
Funny.author: Zig Ziglar

Funny.text: Work until your bank account looks like a phone number.
Funny.author: Unknown

Funny.text: I am so clever that sometimes I don’t understand a single word of what I am saying.
Funny.author: Oscar Wilde

Funny.text: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
Funny.author: Winnie the Pooh

Funny.text: Life is like a sewer … what you get out of it depends on what you put into it.
Funny.author: Tom Lehrer

Funny.text: I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific.
Funny.author: Lily Tomlin

Success.text: Success is not final; failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
Success.author: Winston Churchill

Success.text: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
Success.author: Herman Melville

Success.text: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
Success.author: Colin R. Davis

Success.text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
Success.author: Henry David Thoreau

Success.text: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
Success.author: Dale Carnegie

Success.text: There are three ways to ultimate success: The first way is to be kind. The second way is to be kind. The third way is to be kind.
Success.author: Mister Rogers

Success.text: Success is peace of mind, which is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing you made the effort to become the best of which you are capable.
Success.author: John Wooden

Success.text: I never dreamed about success. I worked for it.
Success.author: Estée Lauder

Success.text: Success is getting what you want; happiness is wanting what you get.
Success.author: W. P. Kinsella

Work.text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work in hand. The sun’s rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
Work.author: Alexander Graham Bell

Work.text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
Work.author: Jim Rohn

Work.text: I’m a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
Work.author: Thomas Jefferson

Work.text: When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better too.
Work.author: Paulo Coelho

Work.text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
Work.author: Thomas Edison

Work.text: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
Work.author: Tony Robbins

Work.text: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven’t found it yet, keep looking. Don’t settle. As with all matters of the heart, you’ll know when you find it.
Work.author: Steve Jobs
